cyclone.name: HARVEY
cyclone.current_location: about 115 miles SE of Corpus Christi, TX
cyclone.trajectory: continuing northwest toward the middle Texas coast, then forecast to stall and meander near/along the coast while slowly edging northeast toward the upper Texas coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Rockport–Port O’Connor, TX (middle Texas coast)

weather_observation.under_warning: Tropical Storm Warning, Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.watch_coast: South of Port Mansfield to the Mouth of the Rio Grande (Storm Surge Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Port Mansfield to High Island (Storm Surge Warning); North of Sargent to High Island (Tropical Storm Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Middle and upper Texas coast, including Galveston Bay and the Houston–Galveston corridor
weather_observation.wind: High likelihood (72%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds with a 1 in 5 chance of 50-kt gusts; gusty conditions could begin late Friday evening and persist into Monday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft of surge forecast for Jamaica Beach to High Island, which includes Texas City and Galveston Bay.
weather_observation.rainfall: 15–25 inches of rain with isolated 35-inch totals expected along the upper Texas coast, producing catastrophic flooding potential in the Texas City area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands; dangerous rip currents and rough seas affecting vessel operations.
